context_evidences: - The Justice Department on Friday released a heavily redacted affidavit that underpinned the FBI's extraordinary search of Mar-a-Lago in which agents seized 11 sets of classified records including some labeled "top secret" as documents that could gravely threaten national security if exposed. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/legal/us-intelligence-conduct-risk-assessment-recovered-mar-a-lago-materials-letter-2022-08-27/ published on 2022-08-27 18:15:53

- Monday's seizure by FBI agents of multiple sets of documents and dozens of boxes, including information about U.S. defense and a reference to the 'French President,' poses a frightening scenario for intelligence professionals. 'It's a nightmarish environment for a careful handling of highly classified information,' said a former U.S. intelligence officer. 'It's just a nightmare.' Reference: https://www.reuters.com/legal/trumps-mar-a-lago-security-nightmare-that-housed-classified-documents-2022-08-13/ published on 2022-08-13 11:10:25

- In the affidavit, an unidentified FBI agent said the agency reviewed and identified 184 documents "bearing classification markings" containing "national defense information" after Trump in January returned 15 boxes of government records sought by the U.S. National Archives. Other records in those boxes, according to the affidavit, bore handwritten notes by Trump. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/legal/government/world/us/us-justice-dept-poised-release-redacted-affidavit-trump-search-2022-08-26/ published on 2022-08-26 10:44:45

- Trump is under federal investigation for possible violations of the Espionage Act, which makes it unlawful to spy for another country or mishandle U.S. defense information, including sharing it with people not authorized to receive it, a search warrant shows. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/legal/trumps-mar-a-lago-security-nightmare-that-housed-classified-documents-2022-08-13/ published on 2022-08-13 11:10:25

- Schiff and Maloney said in a joint statement they were pleased the government was "assessing the damage caused by the improper storage of classified documents at Mar-a-Lago." Politico reported the letter earlier. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/legal/us-intelligence-conduct-risk-assessment-recovered-mar-a-lago-materials-letter-2022-08-27/ published on 2022-08-27 18:15:53

- The FBI agent said in the affidavit that a preliminary review in May of records the Archives earlier received from Trump found 184 "unique documents" labeled as classified - 67 marked "confidential," 92 marked "secret" and 25 marked "top secret." Reference: https://www.reuters.com/legal/government/world/us/us-justice-dept-poised-release-redacted-affidavit-trump-search-2022-08-26/ published on 2022-08-26 10:44:45
correction_response:
This tweet is misinformed. The Department of Justice (DOJ) did not release an assessment stating that no document Trump had in Florida was of value or held risk for the country. On the contrary, the DOJ released a heavily redacted affidavit that underpinned the FBI's search of Trump's Florida residence, where agents seized 11 sets of classified records, some labeled "top secret," that could gravely threaten national security if exposed. The search was part of a federal investigation into whether Trump illegally removed and kept documents when he left office. The U.S. intelligence community is assessing the potential risk to national security of these materials. 
https://www.reuters.com/legal/government/world/us/us-justice-dept-poised-release-redacted-affidavit-trump-search-2022-08-26/
https://www.reuters.com/legal/us-intelligence-conduct-risk-assessment-recovered-mar-a-lago-materials-letter-2022-08-27/
note_1_text: The DOJ has not released any such assessment that this tweet claims, and the investigation is still ongoing. The value of the documents, and the former president's motive for possessing them, is speculative, and doesn't directly determine criminal culpability.     https://www.washingtonpost.com/national-security/2022/11/14/trump-motive-mar-a-lago-documents/
note_2_text: POLITICS  Trump lawyers say he designated seized Mar-a-Lago documents ‘as personal records’ — DOJ says he can’t do that ‘simply by saying so’      https://www.cnbc.com/2022/11/14/trump-argues-seized-mar-a-lago-documents-are-personal-records-.html
queries:
1. DOJ assessment on Trump's documents in Florida after election
2. Value and risk of Trump's documents in Florida according to DOJ
3. DOJ statement on Trump's documents post-election
refute_evidences: - The department released a heavily redacted affidavit that underpinned the FBI's extraordinary Aug. 8 search of Trump's Florida residence in which agents seized 11 sets of classified records including some labeled "top secret" as documents that could gravely threaten national security if exposed. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/legal/government/world/us/us-justice-dept-poised-release-redacted-affidavit-trump-search-2022-08-26/ published on 2022-08-26 10:44:45

- The Justice Department on Friday disclosed that it was investigating Trump for removing White House records because it believed he illegally held documents including some involving intelligence-gathering and clandestine human sources - among America's most closely held secrets. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/legal/us-intelligence-conduct-risk-assessment-recovered-mar-a-lago-materials-letter-2022-08-27/ published on 2022-08-27 18:15:53

- The U.S. intelligence community will assess the potential risk to national security of disclosure of materials recovered during the Aug. 8 search of former President Donald Trump's Florida residence, according to a letter seen by Reuters. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/legal/us-intelligence-conduct-risk-assessment-recovered-mar-a-lago-materials-letter-2022-08-27/ published on 2022-08-27 18:15:53

- The Justice Department’s search warrant raises concerns about national security, said former DOJ official Mary McCord. 'Clearly they thought it was very serious to get these materials back into secured space,' McCord said. 'Even just retention of highly classified documents in improper storage - particularly given Mar-a-Lago, the foreign visitors there and others who might have connections with foreign governments and foreign agents - creates a significant national security threat.' Reference: https://www.reuters.com/legal/trumps-mar-a-lago-security-nightmare-that-housed-classified-documents-2022-08-13/ published on 2022-08-13 11:10:25

- The seizure of classified U.S. government documents from Donald Trump's sprawling Mar-a-Lago retreat spotlights the ongoing national security concerns presented by the former president, and the home he dubbed the Winter White House, some security experts say. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/legal/trumps-mar-a-lago-security-nightmare-that-housed-classified-documents-2022-08-13/ published on 2022-08-13 11:10:25

- The search was part of a federal investigation into whether Trump illegally removed and kept documents when he left office in January 2021 after losing the 2020 election to President Joe Biden and whether Trump tried to obstruct the probe. Reference: https://www.reuters.com/legal/government/world/us/us-justice-dept-poised-release-redacted-affidavit-trump-search-2022-08-26/ published on 2022-08-26 10:44:45
tweet_text: Right after the election, the DOJ releases its assessment that no document Trump had in FL was of value, nor held risk for our country. 🤷🏻
